title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: JSW Steel raises stake in Australian coal venture to 83%
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - **JSW Steel** raises its stake in Illawarra Metallurgical Coal to 83.33% by acquiring an additional economic interest in **M Res NSW** for $60 million via its Netherlands subsidiary.\n- The move enhances raw-material security and cost optimisation, allowing JSW to purchase hard coking coal in line with its greater ownership.\n- This follows an earlier 66.67% stake and was disclosed in an exchange filing.

items.title: GST cut on green power parts may save ₹3,000 cr in power purchases
items.summary:
- The Renewable Energy Ministry says reducing GST on renewable energy equipment could cut tariffs and save about ₹2,000-3,000 crore annually in power procurement.
- Lower GST will make rooftop solar cheaper, with a typical 3 kW system cheaper by about ₹9,000-10,500, benefiting schemes like *PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana* and *PM-Kusum*.
- If India adds around 300 GW of capacity by 2030, even 2-3% cost reductions could free up *₹1-1.5 lakh crore* in investment capacity.

items.title: Waaree to Sell 14.7% Indosolar via OFS
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **Waaree Energies** to sell up to 6.1 million Indosolar shares via OFS at ₹500, a premium to last traded ₹482.15. 
- The stake equals about **14.66%** of Indosolar’s paid‑up capital; Waaree Energies is a promoter. 
- OFS opens for non‑retail on Thursday and for retail on Friday to comply with listing norms.

items.title: China orders ByteDance, Alibaba to halt Nvidia AI chip buys
items.summary:
- The Cyberspace Administration of China ordered Alibaba and ByteDance to cancel orders and halt testing of Nvidia's RTX Pro 6000D to bypass U.S. export controls.
- Beijing's directive marks an intensified push against Nvidia accelerators, following guidance against Nvidia H20.
- The move heightens U.S.–China tech tensions as Nvidia remains pivotal to AI, including scrutiny over its Mellanox acquisition.

items.title: Tata Electronics iPhone shipments ring in maximum gains from US
US multinational General Mills craves stake in Balaji Wafers
items.author: Sagar Malviya
items.summary:
- General Mills is in talks to buy into **Balaji Wafers**, with promoters signaling a ~10% stake sale and potential strategic involvement.
- Balaji aims to bring in strategic investors to help scale and prep for an IPO, with a ~Rs 40,000 crore valuation and plans to expand from four plants to meet national demand.
- Balaji is the third-largest salty snack player in India, strong in Gujarat, Maharashtra and Rajasthan, and the move could open entry to the Rs 45,000 crore savory snack market.

items.title: GST rationalisation to boost energy transition
items.summary:
- **GST rationalisation** will accelerate India's *clean energy transition* and could save up to ₹1.5 lakh crore by 2030. 
- It cuts the renewable energy GST from 12% to 5%, slashing capital costs for solar and boosting *Make in India* and employment. 
- End consumers gain cheaper, reliable energy and faster PPAs, with lower tariffs and CO2 reduction across the sector.

items.title: GRSE preps bigger role in shipbuilding
items.author: P Manoj
items.summary:
- The government is prepping **GRSE** for a larger shipbuilding role by signing MoUs to build *greenfield yards* at Kandla and Raichak with private funds.
- GRSE will sign MoUs with the *Deendayal Port Authority* and *Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port Authority* to develop facilities in Gujarat and West Bengal, expanding capacity for very large vessels.
- The move aims to boost capacity for **Very Large Crude Carriers** and strengthen India's domestic shipbuilding footprint.

items.title: Foxconn Interconnect's Saudi JV to build Middle East factory
items.summary:
- FIT's Saudi JV, named *Smart Mobility*, will start building its first Middle East factory in December to produce **electric vehicle chargers**. 
- The plant is expected to begin production in 2026, as FIT expands into EV connectivity after acquiring Germany's Prettl SWH (renamed FIT Voltaira) and Auto-Kabel. 
- Saudi Arabia targets 30% car electrification by 2030, and FIT's auto-mobility revenue is forecast to reach about **$700 million** this year.

items.title: SiTime releases new chip aimed at wearable gadgets
items.author: Stephen Nellis
items.summary:
- **Titan** is a *silicon-based timing chip* that replaces quartz crystals and is dramatically smaller for wearables.
- Analysts say it could power devices like wireless earbuds and smart glasses, helping SiTime enter a **$4 billion market**.
- SiTime’s CEO says Titan is *highly rugged*, ultra-low power, and tiny, and the company notes it does not disclose its customers.

items.title: Apple explores test production of foldable iPhones in Taiwan
items.summary:
- **Apple** is reportedly *exploring a test production* path for a foldable iPhone in **Taiwan**, aiming to replicate in **India** by 2026.
- The plan targets around **95 million** units in 2026, leveraging Taiwan suppliers' engineering resources to boost production.
- A northern **Taiwan** site is eyed for a pilot line, with Apple not commenting on the report.

items.title: Taiwan's first missile co-built with US arms maker
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *Taiwan unveiled Barracuda-500*, a joint cruise missile with **Anduril Industries**.
- The NCSIST aims to mass-produce it locally, targeting a unit cost under NT$6.5 million with technology transfer.
- This step deepens **Taiwan-US** defense cooperation to deter China and boost island resilience.

items.title: Tesla, SRAM & MRAM to set up EV battery facilities
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The **USD 1 billion** agreement will establish five EV battery factories (gigafactories) in India and 15 other countries, each spanning around **500 acres**.
- SRAM & MRAM Group will lead approvals and incentives while the **TESLA Group a.s.** handles design, engineering, and construction to ensure seamless execution.
- The collaboration aims to create one of the largest global battery manufacturing and storage supply chains for EVs, combining SRAM's expertise with TESLA's BESS tech to drive *sustainable energy* communities.

items.title: Surjewala blames Centre for fertiliser shortage in Karnataka
items.summary:
- Congress general secretary *Randeep Singh Surjewala* says the *Centre* isn't supplying adequate fertilisers to *Karnataka*, citing a *3.36 lakh MT* urea shortfall against a *26.77 lakh MT* Kharif demand. 
- He urged the *Centre* to immediately release the pending *urea*, noting 3.36 lakh MT due April–Sept 2025 and an almost 50% cut this year. 
- He pointed to an early monsoon with a *Kharif* target of *82.50 lakh hectares* and a 2025-26 sowing target of *114.40 lakh hectares*, and said the Karnataka Agriculture Minister met *Chouhan* to press for release to protect farmers.

items.title: EV maker Simple Energy ships rare-earth-free motors
items.summary:
- Simple Energy began commercial production of India's first rare-earth-free motors at its Hosur plant.
- It reinforces the *Built in India, for the World* vision and promotes *geopolitically neutral supply chains*.
- The in-house tech replaces heavy magnets with optimized compounds and real-time heat/torque management for high performance without heavy rare earths.

items.title: Bengaluru researchers create foldable aluminium battery
items.author: Chethan Kumar
items.summary:
- Researchers at CeNS (DST) with CeNSE at IISc developed a *flexible*, **aluminium-ion** battery using aluminium and a water-based electrolyte as a cheaper alternative to lithium-ion cells.
- The battery uses a copper hexacyanoferrate cathode and molybdenum trioxide anode, can bend without losing performance, and retained over **96%** capacity after 150 cycles.
- Published in the Journal of Energy Storage, the work points to applications in *wearables*, foldable gadgets and safer electric vehicles.
keywords: Centre for Nano and Soft Matter Sciences

items.title: US manufacturing job losses deepen amid tariffs, immigration
items.summary:
- A CAP analysis reported by CBS News shows US manufacturing lost 12,000 jobs in August and 42,000 since April, with durable goods hardest hit.
- *Tariffs* have raised costs and uncertainty, with companies like John Deere citing roughly $300 million in tariff-related expenses and thousands of layoffs.
- Experts say *immigration* crackdowns and accelerated *automation* are reinforcing a long-term shift to more capital-intensive manufacturing.

items.title: Hyundai India wage pact with ₹31k monthly hike
items.summary: - The HMIL and UUHE wage settlement guarantees a monthly hike of *₹31,000* in the all-inclusive package, phased 55/25/20 over three years. - The agreement, valid from April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2027, is described as an *industry-best salary revision* achieved through mutual trust and constructive dialogue. - Alongside the wage rise, HMIL will maintain *employee welfare measures* including comprehensive health coverage and wellness programmes, reflecting a progressive workplace culture.

items.title: Pavna to set up auto-components facility in Tamil Nadu
items.summary:
- *Pavna Industries* signs a **MoU** with the *Tamil Nadu government* to set up a manufacturing facility at the **Future Mobility Park** in *Shoolagiri* (Krishnagiri district).
- The *Tamil Nadu government* will provide **full support** to the project, expanding Pavna's footprint across passenger vehicles, two-wheelers, three-wheelers, and commercial segments.
- The initiative aims to create jobs, nurture local talent, and strengthen India's automotive supply chain, aligning with the **Make in India** vision.

items.title: Rivian breaks ground on $5B Georgia EV plant
items.summary:
- Rivian breaks ground on a $5B **Georgia plant** aimed at 200,000 vehicles per year by 2028, seen as the foundation for *profitability* and growth.
- The project faces a tougher EV market, with *tax-credit rollbacks*, tariffs, competition from **Tesla** and legacy automakers, and some local opposition.
- Backed by **VW's $5.8B investment**, a **$6.6B loan** and Georgia incentives, the move aims to make Georgia an *EV mobility hub*.

items.title: JSW Neo frontrunner to acquire Statkraft's HP hydropower unit
items.author: Mohit Bhalla, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *JSW Neo Energy* emerged as frontrunner to acquire *Statkraft*'s Himachal Pradesh hydropower unit, valued at **₹1,200–₹1,400 crore**.
- Other bidders such as *Serentica Renewables* and *Torrent Power* were in the race as *Statkraft* exits India.
- The project is **150 MW** with a capex of **₹2,000 crore**, including an 8 km head-race tunnel; a deal could be signed within days.

items.title: Australia promises $735 million to launch biofuel industry
items.summary:
- *Australia* will invest A$1.1 billion over ten years from 2028 to develop a *low-carbon fuels* industry, including *biodiesel* and **sustainable aviation fuel**. 
- The funding is aimed at boosting demand for biofuel feedstocks like *canola* and *sugarcane* and attracting private investment. 
- Officials say the plan could create regional jobs, support farms, and help Australia reach its *net zero* goal by 2050, with a 2035 target in view.

items.title: Iron ore dips as rising shipments weigh on market
items.summary:
- *Iron ore futures edged lower as rising Brazilian shipments and a cautious steel-demand outlook weighed on the market.*
- *Dalian prices traded about 804.5 yuan/ton and Singapore around $105.6/ton amid shifting demand signals.*
- *Hot metal production rose 117,100 tons MoM to 2.4055 million tons, while end-use steel demand showed weakness in Q3.*

items.title: China's first homegrown advanced chipmaking machine
items.summary: - *SMIC* is testing a domestically produced *DUV* lithography machine by Shanghai startup *Yuliangsheng*, using immersion tech similar to *ASML*.\n- If successful, this could mark an important step toward China's *AI-self-reliance*, enabling more advanced machinery locally.\n- Current access to *EUV* remains restricted; while most components are domestically produced, some parts are imported, and mass production timelines remain uncertain (targeting 2027 for domestic tooling).

items.title: HZL fertiliser plant in Rajasthan to start by Dec 2026
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Zinc*'s ₹1,700 crore fertiliser plant in Rajasthan is expected to start operations by **December 2026**, according to CEO Arun Misra. 
- The first phase will include a phosphoric acid plant by March-April next year, followed by a **DAP** and **NPK** fertilizer line to meet domestic demand as India imports much of its fertilizer. 
- Misra expects *zinc prices* to reach around **USD 3,000/tonne** by December and says the market should not downturn; Hindustan Zinc reported Q1 FY26 results with declines in net profit and revenue.

items.title: TCS, Qualcomm launch Bengaluru Edge AI lab
items.summary:
- TCS and Qualcomm have opened a Bengaluru-based Innovation Lab to co-develop *Edge AI* solutions and **Software Defined Everything (SDx)** for enterprises.
- The lab sits within TCS's IoT-focused Bringing Life to Things Network, with *5G private network* infrastructure to speed prototyping for security, healthcare, smart infrastructure and manufacturing.
- They highlight a past on-edge anomaly-detection project and aim to deliver scalable, energy-efficient, autonomous devices for industrial and consumer use.

items.title: ACE to invest ₹400 crore in Palwal crane plant
items.author: Faizan Haidar, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- ACE to invest around ₹400 crore to establish a 22-acre tower crane facility at Palwal, Faridabad, to meet *surging construction demand*, with 32 acres in Indore for future growth.
- The company aims to double revenues by FY2030, focusing on *backhoe loaders*, defence and agriculture, and expanding its **export footprint**.
- Capacity augmentation and adoption of *next-gen technologies*, along with Palwal infrastructure, strengthen ACE's edge amid India's growth and position it as a **global sourcing hub**.

items.title: KARAM Safety, ReflectoSafe JV targets ₹500cr reflective wear
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **KARAM Safety** formed a joint venture with *ReflectoSafe* to expand its safety workwear portfolio in India, tapping a ₹500 crore market.
- The venture combines *ReflectoSafe*'s ISI-marked high-visibility jackets and a capacity to produce over 1.3 million jackets annually with **KARAM Safety**'s distribution and innovation to target domestic and export markets.
- The collaboration positions **KARAM Safety** as the leading player in India's reflective high-visibility workwear segment.

items.title: ISRO chief inaugurates OrbitAID space-refuelling facility
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - OrbitAID unveiled India's largest space-tech refuelling R&D facility in Bengaluru, inaugurated by ISRO Chairman V Narayanan. - The 6,500 sq ft centre (over $2 million) enables *Rendezvous Proximity Operations & Docking* and *On‑Orbit Servicing & Refuelling*, with a high-end control room and cleanroom. - ISRO signalled openness to private collaboration; OrbitAID plans Tamil Nadu expansion and a propellant handling & satellite servicing hub, aiming to extend satellite life via their SIDRP interface.

items.title: Hinduja Tech's digital simulation boosts automotive safety
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *digital human modelling* tools and *ergonomic analysis* optimize *dashboard sub-assembly*, boosting *operator safety* and efficiency on the shop floor.
- In a project with a leading OEM, the approach cut ergonomic risk scores by 10%, shortened cycle times, and prompted redesigned workstations and **3D work instructions**.
- Supporting over 100 global OEMs, Hinduja Tech positions these simulations as core to *digital manufacturing services*, reducing downtime and costs.

items.title: Arm CEO outlines AI growth and India plans
items.summary: - Rene Haas outlines Arm's *AI* growth plan, naming *India* a key design and ecosystem hub and noting compute subsystems that bundle IP for production.\n- Arm aims to hire and expand faster in *India*, deepen ties with startups and government to build a locally developed *AI* semiconductor ecosystem.\n- With *SoftBank* backing and potential *OpenAI Stargate Project* synergies, Arm stays open to acquisitions to broaden its AI footprint amid governance challenges.

items.title: ₹1,000 crore Ludhiana investment by Happy Forgings
items.summary:
- **Happy Forgings Ltd** to invest ₹1,000 crore in Ludhiana, boosting Punjab's manufacturing sector. 
- The plan foresees phased capex, expanding in Punjab and creating over 2,000 direct jobs, including 300 engineers. 
- A new industrial policy is to be drafted after 23 sectoral committees submit reports by Oct 1, shaping sector-specific inputs.

items.title: CCI clears JSW Paints’ 75% Akzo Nobel India stake
items.summary: - The *CCI* approved JSW Paints Limited’s plan to acquire up to 75% stake in *Akzo Nobel India Limited* via a share purchase agreement and a mandatory *open offer*.\n- The *Acquirer* is part of the *JSW Group*, active in paints and other sectors, while the *Target* is a listed decorative paints and industrial coatings maker in India.\n- The deal could expand JSW’s footprint in India’s decorative paints and coatings market under the Akzo Nobel India umbrella.

items.title: BMC invites bids for Indian-made robotic water rescue devices
items.summary:
- **BMC** reissued the tender for Indian-made robotic water rescue devices under *Make in India*, after cancelling a prior Turkish bid.
- The devices carry a two-year warranty and three years of CSMC, deployed at six Mumbai beaches to support 111 lifeguards.
- Tender requires Indian manufacturers or authorized dealers, compliance with *OEM safety standards*, and delivery to the *Mumbai Fire Brigade* after testing; imported components allowed if certified.

items.title: SAIL draws plans for green push alongside diversification plans
items.author: Suryash Kumar, Twesh Mishra, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Green steel* push includes hydrogen-based steelmaking trials, CCUS, biochar, and renewable energy to decarbonize and modernize SAIL.
- *Diversification* targets sunrise sectors like renewable infrastructure, defence, and electric mobility, backed by automation and AI.
- Capacity will rise from ~19 to ~35 million tonnes by 2030–31, with expanded renewables such as floating/rooftop solar and bagasse power.

items.title: US factory output rises in August amid rebound
items.summary:
- *US factory output rose 0.2% in August*, led by a rebound in *motor vehicle and parts* and stronger *nondurable goods*. 
- *Year-over-year production rose 0.9% in August*, underscoring ongoing growth in the sector. 
- Tariffs weigh on some segments, but *AI spending* boosts others, shaping the mixed outlook for US manufacturing.

items.title: Interarch expands Andhra Pradesh plant phase
items.summary:
- Interarch Building Solutions announced a ₹53 crore expansion across its network, including Phase 2 of the Andhra Pradesh facility for PEBs. 
- The Nellore district plant adds 25,000 MT/year capacity with ₹32 crore investment near ports and industrial corridors, creating 200+ jobs. 
- The Uttarakhand Kichha plant upgrade adds a ₹21 crore Box Column Line and 15,000 MT/year capacity, boosting lead times and product versatility.

items.title: India to build full chip stack: 25 chipsets
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India plans to become a *product nation* by developing 25 strategic chipsets with homegrown IP for domestic and global markets, says Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
- It aims to build the full semiconductor stack—design, manufacturing, equipment, materials and talent—with facilities like Arm’s Bengaluru R&D hub, including **2nm** chip design.
- The ISM 2.0 program will emphasize equipment and materials, fabs and ATMP, plus securing rare earths and critical minerals under the $1B India Deep Tech Alliance.

items.title: Videotex-Samsung to make Tizen TVs in India
items.summary:
- Videotex International Pvt, a home-grown ODM, partners with Samsung to locally manufacture Smart TVs powered by **Tizen OS** in India.
- The collaboration aims to deliver smarter, more intuitive viewing experiences to Indian consumers while reinforcing the **Make in India** ecosystem.
- Videotex, the largest ODM for *webOS Hub* TVs in India, says the move expands its capabilities and portfolio, servicing over 25 brands.

items.title: Gujarat adds record 6,632MW of green power in five months
items.summary:
- *Gujarat* added 6,632 MW of green power from April–August 2025, pushing its RE capacity to about 39,276 MW and nearly matching the entire previous fiscal year. 
- Growth comes from large-scale solar parks, wind farms, rooftop solar, and faster transmission, driven by supportive policy and lower costs. 
- By Aug 31, 2025, ~83% of FY2025 capacity additions occurred in five months, boosting *ESG* goals and setting a new state benchmark for green power.

items.title: FMCG price cuts to boost consumer savings
items.author: Asmita Dey
items.summary: - *HUL* is cutting prices by ₹5-₹76 across products and pack sizes, e.g., 400g *Horlicks* Women's Plus from ₹320 to ₹284.\n- *P&G* will cut ₹3-₹100 on Pamper, Pantene and Vicks from Sept 22, with shifts to larger packs.\n- *Parle* and *Amul* say savings will reach consumers through price cuts and bigger packs as MRPs on old packs are revised.

items.title: IIT Bhilai's self-healing polymer boosts EV safety
items.summary:
- *IIT Bhilai researchers* developed a **self-healing polymer** that repairs at room temperature, boosting safety and longevity for EVs, aircraft, and protective gear.
- The material absorbs strong impacts, heals without external heat, and can be pressed back together after cuts, signaling a *paradigm shift* in resilience.
- Made via a low-cost, scalable process and published in *Advanced Functional Materials*, the polymer is thermally stable, highly adhesive, reusable, and could cut replacements and carbon waste, with a patent filed.

items.title: Tata Sons head highlights capacity building opportunities in defence
ARM's new Bengaluru facility will design two-nanometer chips: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Govt plans to make stricter rules for operating UAV in India
items.summary:
- The government released the draft *Civil Drone (Promotion & Regulation) Bill, 2025*, proposing tougher rules for operating *UAVs* in India.
- It imposes penalties up to ₹1 lakh and up to six months’ imprisonment for violations and requires every unmanned aircraft system to be registered and issued a *UIN*.
- The bill also restricts sale/transfer of UAS unless registered, with transfer and de-registration procedures defined under central government oversight.

items.title: Jindal group company places bid for Thyssenkrupp steel division
items.summary:
- *Jindal Steel International*, the Naveen Jindal Group's global steel arm, made a *non-binding offer* to acquire Thyssenkrupp Steel Europe (*TKSE*).
- *Thyssenkrupp AG* will review the proposal; *no financial details* were disclosed.
- The plan includes a *hydrogen-ready DRI plant in Oman by 2027* and investing *over €2 billion* in new *electric-arc furnaces* in Germany to safeguard production and *decarbonisation*.

items.title: US rejects India's request for WTO consultation on 50% copper tariffs
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The US rejected India's WTO request for consultations over 50% copper tariffs, saying they are not *safeguard measures*.
- It told the *WTO* there is no basis for India to seek consultations under the AoS, as tariffs are not **safeguards** under **Section 232**.
- This is the **third rejection** by Washington after cases on steel/aluminium and autos.

items.title: Tata Consumer Products planning premiumisation of portfolio to drive growth in tea business
Divergent raises $290M to scale 3D printing
items.summary:
- Divergent Technologies raised $290 million at a $2.3 billion valuation to scale additive manufacturing for defense and aerospace.
- The round includes $250 million in equity and $40 million in debt, led by Rochefort Asset Management, to accelerate production facilities.
- The deal underscores strong investor interest in next-gen manufacturing tech amid supply-chain pressures in defense sectors.

items.title: India's chemicals sector leads globally with 28% TSR
items.summary:
- *India's chemicals sector* has become a global leader in value creation, delivering a five-year TSR of **28%** from 2020 to 2024, well above the global average of **7%**.
- This outperformance was driven by *domestic demand*, policy support, and rising investor sentiment that lifted valuation multiples, with agrochemicals, *pharmaceutical ingredients*, personal care, and engineered materials leading the gains.
- *BCG* notes that Indian firms focusing on *commercial excellence*, disciplined *capital allocation*, and *portfolio quality* are positioned to sustain momentum, including strong fertiliser demand.
